early.description: Born in a region under constant conflict, your earliest memories are of distant explosions and the sounds of warfare.
At age seven, you learned to navigate war-torn streets to find food and supplies, honing your agility.
You witnessed a skirmish between rival factions, teaching you to stay hidden and move silently.
An encounter with armed soldiers forced you to flee, developing your endurance and speed.
You developed a knack for finding safe routes through dangerous territories.
A family member was injured, and you had to carry them to safety, building your strength.
You customized makeshift protective gear from scavenged materials, showing ingenuity.
An older survivor taught you basic combat skills for self-defense.
You formed a bond with another child survivor, relying on each other for survival.
A close call with a collapsing building sharpened your reflexes and instincts.
You began mapping safe zones and danger areas, increasing your chances of survival.
An illness due to poor conditions tested your resilience and willpower.
You discovered a hidden cache of supplies, improving your situation temporarily.
A family member disappeared during a raid, prompting you to become more self-reliant.
You started studying abandoned manuals and books, enhancing your knowledge.
An encounter with a sympathetic soldier provided you with crucial survival tips.
You developed a skill for moving unnoticed through conflict zones.

mid.description: You joined a group of survivors, pooling resources and skills to stay alive.
A conflict with another survivor tested your combat abilities and resolve.
You infiltrated a restricted area to obtain vital supplies, showcasing stealth and courage.
An opportunity to evacuate arose, challenging your trust in others.
You began mentoring younger survivors, teaching them how to navigate dangers.
A personal loss due to the war made you question your path.
You discovered evidence of corporate involvement in the conflict, sparking anger.
A romantic relationship complicated your survival priorities.
You faced ethical choices when resources were scarce.
An injury forced you to adapt your methods, relying more on agility than strength.

late.description: Elevated to a leadership role among survivors, you coordinated efforts to stay alive.
A major conflict threatened your group's existence, requiring decisive action.
You uncovered a plan that could end the conflict, prompting difficult choices.
Faced with a moral dilemma, you had to choose between personal survival and the greater good.
An opportunity to join a resistance movement challenged your priorities.
You exposed a traitor within your group, preventing disaster.
A personal tragedy prompted deep reflection on your life's direction.
You began to suffer from the psychological effects of prolonged conflict.
A movement to escape the warzone gained momentum, and you had to decide your role.
You mentored a young survivor, hoping to pass on your knowledge.
Conditions worsened, making survival increasingly difficult.
You authored a journal documenting survival techniques and experiences.
An external threat, such as a new faction or environmental hazard, endangered your group.
You faced a critical decision when offered a chance to escape at the expense of others.
An unexpected alliance offered new possibilities but also new risks.
You considered the legacy you would leave and how to effect lasting change.
A technological advancement changed the dynamics of the conflict, forcing you to adapt.
